title: Label
description: A flexible, theme-aware label component built with Tailwind CSS and class-variance-authority. Easily adaptable for any input, checkbox, or form element.

body.raw:
# Label Component Documentation The **Label** component is a lightweight, theme-aware, and variant-powered text label that can be used with form controls like inputs, checkboxes, radio buttons, and more. It's built using **Tailwind CSS** and **class-variance-authority (CVA)** for scalable styling logic. ## Preview and Code Snippet Preview Code
```tsx import { Label } from "@/components/label"; import { Input } from "@/components/input"; export default function Example() { return (
); } ``` ## Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | |------------|---------------------------------------------------------|-----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------| | `intent` | `"default" \| "muted" \| "error"` | `default` | Visual style of the label based on context or form state. | | `className`| `string` | `""` | Additional Tailwind utility classes to extend styles. | | `...props` | `React.LabelHTMLAttributes` | â€“ | All standard label attributes like `htmlFor`, `children`, etc. | ## Styling The component uses `class-variance-authority` to manage label style variants: ```ts const labelVariants = cva("text-sm font-medium leading-none", { variants: { intent: { default: "text-gray-900 dark:text-gray-100", muted: "text-gray-500 dark:text-gray-400", error: "text-red-600 dark:text-red-400", }, }, defaultVariants: { intent: "default", }, }); ``` You can customize these classes to match your design system. ## Usage Example ```tsx ``` --- Use the `Label` component for accessible, consistent labeling in all your forms. It pairs perfectly with custom input components like `Checkbox`, `Input`, or `TextArea`.
